Who am I?

My name is Christian, and I'm a freelance web developer, artist and outdoor educator based out of Asheville, North Carolina. I have 8 years of experience as a web developer, and many more making games. Using the latest technologies and frameworks, I try to make sites that are responsive and intuitive. When I'm not working on projects I'm making art, rock climbing, tending to my garden and taking people on outdoor adventures in the mountains. I am available for work. If you have a project in mind and need help executing it, contact me here

Recent Projects:

AVL DTG
Veritable Threads
Lean Times Meat Co
Vengerberg Glamarye
My Personal Portfolio

Asheville DTG:

AVL DTG is a custom apparel company based in Asheville, NC. Focused on delivering the finest customized apparel for both Businesses and Individuals such as T-Shirts, Tank Tops, Hoodies and more from premier apparel wholesellers.

Open New Tab

Veritable Threads:

Veritable Threads sells exclusive designs on quality fabrics. Veritable Threads a unique Apparel Fasion Company that sells it's eye-popping designs on any apparel style.

Open New Tab

Lean Times Meat Co:

Lean times Meat Co provides and delivers locally-sourced meat from the trusted farms of Western North Carolina to the doorsteps of the community, with a focus on better choice for human health and the environment.

Open New Tab

Vengerberg Glamarye:

The Official Site of Vengerberg Glamarye-The Original Witcher-Inspired Crème Perfume. Charlotte sells high-end perfumes inspired by the Witcher franchise.

Open New Tab

My Personal Portfolio:

I made this site as an update to a pre-existing portfolio I had up for a few years. My main goal was to incorporate three.js library with 3D models on a full-screen rendered background, and have the HTML contents of my portfolio displayed responsively on top of it.

You're Already Here!

My Games:

Turkey Flight
Nugsweeper
Spellweave Online
Vikings Quest
Asteroid Defense

Turkey Flight:

A really simple clone of flappy bird I made but with a turkey that is really bad at flying. This was my first experiment with using Unity to render webGL games on HTML5 Canvas.

Play Game

Nugsweeper:

A minesweeper clone I made as a birthday present for someone special. Twitch chat integrated.

Play Game

Spellweave Online:

A 1v1 elemental-mixing turn based combat game thats a work-in-progress. Right now you can mess around with a fun little avatar creator.

Play Game

Viking's Quest:

One of the first games I made in Flash when I was younger. It's a sidescroller with multiple weapons, level up abilities, different enemies with their own basic AI, and has four levels with one final boss fight.

Play Game

Asteroid Defense:

The first game I ever made in Flash when I was 15 years old. It's very slow and not fun and it doesn't have an end state, but it kickstarted my fascination with game development and I'm still proud of it.

Play Game
The Wheel Keeps Spinning

A posterboard peice I did in 2013 with black ultra-fine sharpies. This was inspired by the bhāvacakra--a buddhist symbolic representation of Samsara and the cycles of existence--found in many Budhhist temples and recreated by many artists throughout time. The difference in my version is there is no buddha/moon symbol representing nirvana, or escape, and there is sometimes one more layer outside the six realms. The three animals in the middle represent the three spiritual poisons (greed, desire and aversion). The main part of the wheel is compromised of Six Realms, starting from the bottom left and going clockwise--The Animal Realm, The Human Realm, The Deva (divine) Realm, The Asura (demi-gods) Realm, The Hungry Ghost Realm, and finally the Neraka Realm (elemental hell).

The Stoned Ape

My first black marker + watercolor combination, credit to Jasmine Winchester for the watercolor fill. Depicts a curious chimpanzee pondering the mysteries of the universe with help from a sacred herb. Circa 2009.

Ganesha

A depiction of Ganesha--a commonly worshiped deity in the Hindu pantheon--done with black marker and colored pencil circa 2010. Ganesha, the son of Shiva and Parvati, is called the remover of obstacles and is a deity associated with good luck, intellectual pursuits and wisdom.

Ataraxia

Another experiment with black marker and watercolors, circa 2011.

Connected

Done with black ultra-fine sharpies, circa 2010.

Through The Veil

Black sharpies and watercolor again, circa 2012. I was experimenting more with blending paint.

Addictions

Sharpies on a small canvas, circa 2011.

Monkey and Machine

Sharpies and colored pencil on paper, circa 2012. This was theuraptic drawing all the lines in each wire.

Wolf Runes

Black sharpies on paper, circa 2010. I had a phase where I became obsessed with reading about Norse mythology, and this peice probably was inspired by that.
